meanings.sent1: She looked around superstitiously before entering the old house.
meanings.sent2: He always taps his foot superstitiously three times before taking a test.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed superstitiously at the mirror, as if expecting a different reflection.
meanings.sent4: The old tree creaked superstitiously in the wind, as if whispering ancient secrets.
meanings.sent5: The child held onto his lucky charm superstitiously, believing it would protect him from harm.

meanings.definition: With irrational beliefs in supernatural influences
meanings.sent1: The superstitious man avoided walking under ladders superstitiously.
meanings.sent2: She had a superstitious fear of black cats crossing her path.
meanings.sent3: The superstitious belief in ghosts made him sleep with a nightlight.
meanings.sent4: The superstitious rituals of the tribe were passed down through generations.
meanings.sent5: The superstitious sailor always wore his lucky socks on stormy days.

meanings.definition: Showing excessive fear or belief in luck
meanings.sent1: Her superstitious behavior included avoiding cracks on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: He had a superstitious habit of carrying a rabbit's foot for good luck.
meanings.sent3: The superstitious athlete wore his lucky socks to every game.
meanings.sent4: The superstitious student always sat in the same seat for exams.
meanings.sent5: The superstitious tradition of throwing salt over the shoulder continued in the family for years.
